To demonstrate your honesty as a writer, it is important to give credit to those whose ideas you have borrowed.<br /><br />Stephen Jefferson wrote an article titled &quot;All About Acadia: The Basics,&quot; published in the<em> Journal of Parks and Recreation.</em><br /><br />In the introduction he provides interesting information about Acadia National Park:<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"color: black; font-family: times new roman,serif; font-size: 14px; width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><strong>All About Acadia: The Basics</strong><br /><br />Acadia National Park, located near Bar Harbor, Maine, is the oldest national park east of the Mississippi River.&nbsp; The park has undergone various name changes over the years.&nbsp; It began as the Sieur de Monts National Park in 1916, when President Woodrow Wilson granted the park federal status.&nbsp; It was then renamed Lafayette National Park in 1919.&nbsp; It did not take the name of Acadia National Park until 1929. The name &quot;Acadia&quot; is a tribute to the former French colony of Acadia, which once included what is now the state of Maine.&nbsp; One of the park&#39;s most popular features is Cadillac Mountain, where you can see the sun rise earlier than you can at any other place within the United States.&nbsp;</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Why documenting sources is important"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>You use some of this information when you write about Acadia National Park.&nbsp; Why do you need to give credit to Stephen Jefferson?<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_405e0030-dc53-e066-c0e6-da281c0f671a\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_405e...</strong></jumc><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>The paragraph from your hiking article with in-text citations looks like this.&nbsp; The in-text citations are indicated with highlighting:</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><span class=\"ju-double-space\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:15px;line-height:180%;\">Acadia National Park is the northernmost and easternmost national park in the United States.&nbsp; It is also the &quot;oldest national park east of the Mississippi River&quot; <span class=\"marker\">(Jefferson, 2012, p. 17)</span>.&nbsp; Over the course of its history, its name has changed three times: from Sieur de Monts National Park in 1916, to Lafayette National Park in 1919, to Acadia National Park in 1929 <span class=\"marker\">(Jefferson, 2012)</span>. The park is located in the northern part of Maine near Bar Harbor.</span></td></tr></tbody></table><p><br /><img alt=\"\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" />&nbsp;See the mini-lesson <em>Basic rules for documenting sources</em> for information about formatting in-text citations.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRFB":1,"showRuler":1},"leftText":"<p><strong>2.&nbsp;
